CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Split .

CARDINAL . The applicant worked for the company PERSON ( “ the company ” ) for DATE . By virtue of a DATE court decision and the subsequent decision of the company in DATE , he was granted use of a privately owned flat . However , he was not able to move into the flat until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a civil action against the company and T.V. as the owner of the flat seeking damages for not having been able to move into the flat until DATE and for having had to renovate it . Subsequently , ORG filed a counterclaim seeking the applicant ’s eviction from the flat and the payment of rent for the time he had spent in it .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ORG ) dismissed both the applicant ’s claim and ORG counterclaim .

CARDINAL . On appeal , on CARDINAL DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case in so far as it involved the payment of rent by the applicant . At the same time , ORG upheld the remainder of the first - instance judgment in its part concerning the applicant ’s claim and ORG claim for the applicant ’s eviction , which thereby became final . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) declared his appeal inadmissible , because the value of the subject matter in dispute did not reach the threshold prescribed by law .

CARDINAL . In the resumed first - instance proceedings , the applicant withdrew his claim in respect of the company , but maintained in his action against T.V. During the proceedings , also ORG changed his counterclaim on several occasions . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a constitutional complaint concerning the length of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) dismissed the applicant ’s complaint as ill - founded . It found that , at the time when the applicant had lodged his constitutional complaint , the proceedings before ORG had been pending for DATE and that therefore , on the basis of the existing case - law of ORG , the conditions set out in section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW were not fulfilled .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the first - instance judgment in its part concerning the order to pay to ORG the rent . At the same time , the second - instance court remitted the case in its part concerning the exact amount of the rent due .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of section CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , of CARDINAL DATE ; “ the LAW ” ) reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the court with jurisdiction fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant ’s rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...
